The Maitre d' --Dennis--always greets us as if we've been friends for years and seemingly he's everywhere at once making sure everyone is enjoying this dining experience. column13: I was surprised that this restaurant did not have a full bar. It's in a casino hotel... you would think they could figure something out. If you do not have a full bar, then you need to have some better wine options.

column4: 3650 S Decatur Blvd Las Vegas, NV  89103
column13: Fish was fantastically fresh. Staff was very nice; sushi chef was friendly and willing to modify menu sushi items to fit our desires. Sushi menu (rolls) is limited for those not interested in the cooked or baked 'sushi' items.

column1: Silverado Steak House - South Point Casino
column4: 9777 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89183
column13: My husband and I really enjoyed the food I had the sparerib and he had a steak and they were both beyond delicious... I would definitely dine there again ...

column4: 4381 W Flamingo Las Vegas, NV  89103
column13: Very good food & drink. Friendly and accomodating staff. Definitely worth a visit.

column1: SINATRA – Encore at Wynn Las Vegas
column4: 3131 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Ambience was very special, it was truly beautiful. Was a little pricy for simple Italian food as well as the wine. $150 per person.

column4: 3730 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Sirio, in the Aria Resort, offers good italian cuisine in a nice atmosphere. While others have raved about the brilliantly-designed setting, it wasn't anything outstanding to me (the center ceiling medallion looked like something out of "Close Encounters of the Third Kind," which doesn't really say "italian" to me...). The food is good (vermicelli-wrapped shrimp and wagyu beef were wonderful!), but the fish and prawn were terribly overcooked.

column4: 3930 Las Vegas Blvd South Ste 120 Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: Pros: Michelle our server was great; the food runner was personable and amusing. A decent chianti and a good price. The vegan pizza was tasty and the vegan chocolate cake was over-the-top delicious!

column4: 3767 Las Vegas Blvd Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Steak was horrible. Tasteless and fatty. Manager came over and said they do not trim the steaks but did not address the tasteless issue. They didn't offer to make anything better or take it off the bill. Will not be back and would not recommend to anyone. Waste of money and their steaks are not cheap. Would have given it no stars.

column4: 3720 S. Las Vegas Blvd. South #241 Las Vegas, NV  89158
column13: My husband and I decided to go out for a very nice dinner while in Vegas - not something we do often (ever) as he is not a "foodie" and doesn't value an expensive meal. Therefore, I usually save my fine dining experiences for business or with friends. Our server, Daniel, was fantastic - did a great job of leading us through the menu with wonderful suggestions. Every dish was amazing - especially the kobe beef "sushi" dish we had. The cod dish was also exquisite, but we were too full by the time it came to truly enjoy it. Surprisingly, the alcohol prices were extremely reasonable which added to the overall experience. The sushi rolls were quite large so actually ended up a pretty good value, considering the quality of the food.

column4: 3500 Las Vegas Boulevard, South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Spago has both inside quiet romantic dining and outside patio for people watching inside the Caesar's Palace Forum Shops Mall. The outside patio has a more moderate priced menufrom everything like pizza, pasta, sandwiches & appetizers. A more expansive menu is available inside but was offered to us as well. If you order one of the "chef's specials" you might get a surprise visit from "Chef Eric Klein" himself. That was quite a highlight for us and made the evening a special memory.

column4: Mirage Hotel & Casino 3400 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: My favorite fine dining restaurant in Vegas hands down!!!

column1: The Steakhouse at Camelot - Excalibur - MGM Resorts
column4: 3850 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: A good value restaurant with decent quality food.

column1: THE Steakhouse at Circus Circus - Las Vegas
column4: Circus Circus Hotel & Casino 2880 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Pricing was actually quite reasonable for such a high quality food. The prices include the steak and all of the sides that go with it. I would highly recommend this to everyone.

column1: STK - The Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas
column4: 3708 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Food was exceptionable!!!!!!!!!!!!

column4: 3667 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Professional staff made the meal enjoyable. Waiter (John) was very knowledgeable on menu options and offered honest opinions when I asked between to entrees. My lobster bisque was quite good as a starter, and veal chop entree was well prepared. We didn't love the setting - room was covered with hundreds of old photos of strippers (yeah, we get the Strip House theme but this was overkill), music was relatively loud with a too heavy bass beat, etc. In the end, the meal was good, but We still clearly prefer Craftsteak at MGM as our favorite steakhouse in Vegas.

column4: 3950 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: We had a wonderful time!!! The service was amazing and the food was unforgettable!!! We will definitely be back again!!! P.S. the cocktails are FABULOUS!!!!!!!

column4: 3655 Las Vegas Blvd. Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Not a place for a romantic date. You practically sit with other people and it takes away from the intimacy. Quality of food is good not great. Afterall they are known for their desserts.

column4: 3500 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: We only had the sushi and it was good. Be prepared to pay twice what you're used to. I guess they have to cover their huge overhead somehow. Btw, I eat sushi all over the country , so when I say good I mean it.

column4: 3325 Las Vegas Boulevard South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Amazing eats and fantastic service! We had a great waiter (Max) who recommended the chef's tasting menu. He asked our likes, dislikes and created a custom menu for us at a price point we chose ($50 per person minimum). We were in heaven! Everything was phenomenal and we are still talking about how great the meal was!

column4: 3325 Las Vegas Boulevard South The Shoppes at Palazzo Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: This was my first time to Table 10 and definitely would return. The service was top-notch/very attentive and the food was outstanding. We ordered from a special menu - the quality and taste was impressive. Next time we are in town, Table 10 is on the short list of places to return to.

column4: 3377 S. Las Vegas Blvd., Suite 2025 Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Awesome dinner, first time here despite many trips to vegas. Would highly recommend.

column4: 3377 Las Vegas Blvd. Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: We really enjoyed this restaurant and were able to get a table right next to the canal, which made for a great dinner atmosphere - even saw a couple get engaged on a gondola! The food was pretty good as we each had burritos (the chicken and shrimp). No complaints, would visit again.

column4: 3752 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89158
column13: We had the Afternoon Tea, the food was great. The service wasn't. I'm not sure if it was done on purpose because they wanted to leave you alone, but no one was by the tables. If you wanted something you needed to wait until one of the three servers came out of the back which wasn't often. However once they did they were very attentive, which is why i questioned if leaving you alone to enjoy the food and the view of the Strip. I can see how it may get noisy if there were a lot of hotel guest checking in because you're seated in the lobby while we were there it was fine.

column1: Technique at Le Cordon Bleu – Las Vegas
column4: 1451 Center Crossing Road Las Vegas, NV  89144
column13: Very good food and service. Always enjoy going to this restaurant and the tips go to student scholarships.

column4: 3900 Las Vegas Blvd South Luxor Hotel & Casino Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: Very nice restaurant - food was outstanding, booths very private - could have been even darker! Not inexpensive, but worth it for a special occasion.

column1: TJ's Steakhouse - LVH – Las Vegas Hotel & Casino
column4: 3000 Paradise Road Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Classic styles entrance warms you to get to the bar or sit outside the restaurant and enjoy some history if a place that was built during the 60's to last. The food and service were exceptional, my business guests were impressed and the price overall was reasonable. No old foggy scent plus quiet enough for a business dinner

column4: 4350 E. Sunset Rd. Henderson, NV  89014
column13: I have been to Todd's Unique Dining many times over the years. This restaurant is consistently excellent. Todd's offers great food, great service, and a warm atmosphere each and every time.

column1: Tommy Bahama's Restaurant & Bar - Las Vegas
column4: 6635 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: Our waitress Naomi was very attentive. Enjoyed the relaxed setting. We ordered fish tacos which were fresh and filling.

column1: Top of the World Restaurant - Stratosphere Hotel
column4: 2000 Las Vegas Blvd S Las Vegas, NV  89104
column13: Excelent. Nice views. Good Food. Very Good Service. An Outstanding Ambiance. It's nice for special Occasion with your wife at Las Vegas.We never forget this dinner for two reasons.The first because it was a very special dinner with excellent panoramic views and had a very nice time.The second because when we finished and we were down in the elevator stood on the ground 101.

column4: Forum Shops Caesars Palace 3500 Las Vegas Blvd. S. Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Great food and great atmosphere. Drinks were also very good!

column4: 255 E Flamingo Rd Las Vegas, NV  89169
column13: Great as alwasys love the Sea Bass

column4: 3333 Blue Diamond Road Las Vegas, NV  89139
column13: Very nice surprise! High end steak house that can compete and beat many on the strip. Ambience changes depending on where you get seated. Energetic in some spots romantic in the booths. Pricey, but less then steakhouses on the strip. All steaks and prime rib perfectly cooked.

column1: Twist by Pierre Gagnaire - Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas
column4: 3752 Las Vegas Blvd S Las Vegas, NV  89158
column13: Wonderful overall experience, attentive and amusing staff and delicious food - plate presentation and flavor combinations were outstanding and unique - very satisfied.

column4: 3355 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: This was a fantastic place to sit down for a quiet dinner with some friends. The service was very prompt, however I had to wait outside as they only seat the entire table but they still honored my reservation - 45 minutes late.

column4: 191 South Arroyo Grande Henderson, NV  89012
column13: My friends and enjoyed the evening, we opted for an outside table, which was great. Will most definitely will come back again for the great food and the views of Las Vegas.

column4: 3960 Las Vegas Blvd. South Las Vegas, NV  89119
column13: Breakfast is always great here. We like the outdoor seating when weather permits. Chef Antonio features regional 3 course prix fixe specials from his native Italy. Ingredients are the highest and freshest quality, and there is a choice of two for each course. The latest visit was Liguria, featuring basil, Genoa salami. fresh peaches, balsamic vinegar. We tried both of each course, for optimal variety. Although portions appeared on the small side, this perception was deceptive. Each bite was a powerhouse of flavors, we were quite satisfied. We never had to leave the hotel for meals, a reflection of quality in this competitive restaurant town, rather than convenience or laziness.

column4: 1225 S. Fort Apache Rd. Ste 100 Las Vegas, NV  89117
column13: Excellent food and service, the staff all seem to work together to make the dining experience unforgettable. Keep up the good work!

column4: 129 E. Fremont Street The Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino Las Vegas, NV  89101
column13: Fantastic dinner, the best steak ever!

column4: 2121 East Craig Rd Las Vegas, NV  89030
column13: Vino's has seen some design changes since our last visit to the better. Its a brighter more at home place. The menue has also undergone some changes with some new items along with another albeit small price increase. We had the wild mushroom alfredo with mushrooms, pine nuts and sun dried tomatoes and this was a sure winner, which we would have again. Also had our regular bolognese which is loaded with meat sauce and always great. Breadsticks at the beginning are addictive. They have done away with bussers which is a big mistake as it really slows down the service. I'm sure they are trying to save a few bucks. A resataurant.com gift cert and casino comps made this a no cost meal except for the 20% tip.

column4: 10100 W. Charleston Blvd. Suite 150 Las Vegas, NV  89135
column13: I LOVED THIS RESTAURANT. I LOOK FORWARD TO GOING BACK. It is surprising to find it in the midst of a business complex. It was a great surprise to see the layout. I loved the aesthetics, the color scheme, the food, the service.

column1: Waverly's Steak House - Cannery Casino & Hotel
column4: 2121 E Craig Road Las Vegas, NV  89030
column13: Ordered prime rib after being told I could get rare. What came out was medium at best and the waiter said since it's so thick, it would be rare on the inside. Waiter also said if it wasn't to my liking, he could bring the rib eye. Upon cutting into the prime rib, it was still medium at best. Waiter did bring a rare rib eye after showing him the prime rib and they did take off my baked potato off the bill. Just felt that with this type of restaurant, if it didn't look anywhere near rare, he shouldn't have brought it out.

column4: 3131 Las Vegas Boulevard South, Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: WOW! No wonder this is the only restaurant of its type to receive the AAA Four Diamond Award! The table settings are immaculate, the chairs are beyond major comfort and the first thing to do is order "The Dreamer" cocktail! Pricey, but completely worth it!!! The food is at least 7 star quality!

column4: 3799 Las Vegas Blvd South MGM Grand Hotel Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Three of us went to Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Las Vegas for an early light dinner. I ordered Spicy Tuna Tatare, which was the only excellent item we ate. The second diner ordered House Made Spaghettini Pasta, which consisted of marginal pasta, warm canned (yes canned) tomatoes and chopped fresh basil. The third diner had Ricotta Gnocchi, Sweet Fennel Sausage Bolognese. If it had any sausage, it was not visable. Since the dish was very greasy, perhaps it only had the fat from the sausage. The mojito I ordered was flat and the limes were off flavor. In addition, the bill had higher prices than the menu. Perhaps we were given the lunch menu and charged for dinner. On the positive side, the service was excellent.

column4: 3720 Las Vegas Blvd. South #240 Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Not the Wolfgang Puck experience that I was expecting. The setting was mall-like and the food was average. When beingHeld to higher standards in Las Vegas, there are many alternative choices. The staff was friendly but clumsy. They plopped down a free anniversarry dessert without saying anything about the occasion or if we had ordered it.....awkward.

column4: 3600 Las Vegas Blvd S Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: High light of our trip! It was more than a meal it was a wonderful experience. I cant wait to come back to eat their again. The Sushi was top shelf all the way.

column4: 3667 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Had my daughter's bachelorette party at Yolo. Food was great, and they were more than accomodating for a big group. We try to get to Yolo every trip to Vegas as the food is good and reasonably priced.

column4: 3377 Las Vegas Blvd. So. Suite 2095 Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: Great food, perfect ambience, service outstanding. Can't say enough, thoroughly enjoyable, extremely satisfied

column4: 3355 Las Vegas Blvd South Las Vegas, NV  89109
column13: This resturaunt stayed very true to the Chinese and Vietnamese flavors that I'm used to at home! The oxtail pho was a nice surprise with the actual oxtail added into the soup (it's often only used for broth) and the gai lan that we asked for with oyster sauce was spot on. The oxtail was well done along with the tripe and I would definetly hit it up again.
